name: ASONAM

name: SNAA
description: Workshop on Social Network Analysis in Applications.

name: CNDay

name: CompleNet

name: EUSN
description: European Conference on Social Networks.

name: GD
description: International Symposium on Graph Drawing and Network Visualization.

name: PolNet

name: Videos from the Political Networks 2009 Conference.
NetSci
description: International School and Conference on Social Networks - Organized by the Network Science Society (NetSci).

name: Sunbelt
description: Social Networks Conference of the International Network for Social Network Analysis - Organized by the International Network for Social Network Analysis (INSNA).

name: Complex Networks, by Peter Sheridan Dodds (University of Vermont, 2016; Twitter: @networksvox).
Tarot Cards for Principles of Complex Systems and Complex Networks.
Graph Theory and Applications, by Paul Van Dooren
description: Full lecture slides (Hamilton Institute, Dublin, 2009).

name: Graph Theory (Mathematics), by Christopher Griffin
description: Full lecture notes (Penn State University, 2012).

name: Network Analysis and Modeling (Computer Science), by Aaron Clauset
description: Full lecture slides and readings (University of Colorado, 2014).

name: Networks, Complexity and Its Applications (Media Arts and Sciences), by Cesar Hidalgo (MIT, 2011).
Networks, Crowds and Markets, by David Easley, Jon Kleinberg and Eva Tardos (presentation; Cornell University via edX, 2016).
Networks (Economics), by Daron Acemoglu and Asu Ozdaglar (MIT, 2009).
Network Science (Computer Science), by Constantine Dovrolis
description: Mostly open access readings (Georgia Tech, 2015).

name: Network Science (Physics), by Albert-László Barabási, Sean Cornelius and Roberta Sinatra (Northeastern University, 2015).
Political Networks: Methods and Applications, by Zeev Maoz (University of California in Davis, 2012).
Social and Economic Networks: Models and Analysis, by Matthew O. Jackson (Stanford University via Coursera, 2015).
Social Network Analysis, by Lada Adamic (University of Michigan via Coursera, not yet run).
Social Network Analysis and Intermediate Social Network Theory, by Matthew J. Denny
description: Workshop notes and slides (2014–5).

name: Social Network Analysis with Pajek, by Andrej Mrvar (University of Ljubljana, 2016).
Social Networks, by Dennis M. Feehan (University of Berkeley, 2017).
The Structure of Information Networks, by Jon Kleinberg
description: Links to many diverse readings (Cornell University, 2008).

name: Bill Cosponsorship Networks in European Parliaments
description: Legislative cosponsorship networks, in R format.

name: Colorado Index of Complex Networks (ICON)
description: Large collection of networks described and indexed by Aaron Clauset's research group.

name: Connectome
description: Comprehensive maps of neural connections.

name: igraphdata
description: R data-centric package.

name: Interaction Web Database
description: Ecological species interactions.

name: International Currencies 1890-1910
description: Historical data on the international connections between 45 currencies.

name: KONECT
description: The Koblenz Network Collection - Includes, among other things, networks of collaboration in DBpedia and Wikipedia, GitHub (companion handbook).

name: James H. Fowler’s Cosponsorship Network Data Page.
Linton Freeman’s Network Data
description: Over 300 datasets of all sorts, in UCINET format.

name: Mangal
description: Online platform to analyze, archive and share ecological network data (preprint, Python package, R package).

name: Mark E.J. Newman’s Network Data (example visualizations).
Network Repository
description: Fully searchable database containing hundreds of real-world networks.

name: Nexus
description: Repository of network datasets in GraphML and igraph formats.

name: Norwegian Interlocking Directorate, 2002-2011
description: Two-mode and one-mode data on gender representation in Norwegian firms.

name: Philosophers Networks from Randall Collins's The Sociology of Philosophies.
SocioPatterns Datasets
description: Network data obtained through the SocioPatterns sensing platform.

name: tnet Datasets
description: Weighted network data.

name: UCINET Datasets
description: Network data in UCINET format.

name: AFS RT 26 “Réseaux sociaux”
description: Thematic Network of the French Sociological Association (AFS), in French.

name: APSA Political Networks
description: Organized Section of the American Political Science Association (APSA).

name: ECPR Political Networks SG
description: Standing Group of the European Consortium for Political Research (Twitter account).

name: GDR ARSHS
description: GDR Analyse de réseaux en sciences humaines et sociales, in French - Research group based in Paris.

name: Groupe FMR
description: Flux, Matrices, Réseaux, in French.

name: INSNA
description: International Network for Social Network Analysis (SOCNET mailing-list).

name: Mathematical Sociology Section of the American Sociological Association (ASA).
NetSci
description: Network Science Society.

name: Annenberg Networks Network (ANN)
description: Research group studying social networks at the University of Southern California.

name: Center for Applied Network Analysis (CANA)
description: Research group based at the University of Southern California School of Medicine.

name: Channing Division of Network Medicine
description: Research division within the Department of Medicine at Brigham and Women’s Hospital.

name: Complex Human Networks Reading Group (CoHN)
description: Reading list from a seminar held at MIT in 2001–2.

name: Interdependence in Governance and Policy Research Group
description: Led by Bruce A. Desmarais at Penn State University.

name: Interdisciplinary Center for Network Science and Applications (iCeNSA) at the University of Notre Dame.
LINKS Center for Social Network Analysis at the Gatton College of Business and Economics, University of Kentucky.
NetSCI Lab at the Rutgers School of Communication and Information.
Network Dynamics Group at the Annenberg School for Communication, University of Pennsylvania (Twitter: @NDGannenberg).
Network Interdependence in Social Systems (NISS Lab)
description: Led by Skyler J. Cranmer at Ohio State University.

name: Network Science Center at the U.S. Military Academy (USMA) in West Point (blog).
Network Science IGERT at the University of California at Santa Barbara (UCSB)
description: Features an NSF-funded graduate programme.

name: Networks, Computation, and Social Dynamics Lab
description: Headed by Carter T. Butts. Part of the Center for Networks and Relational Analysis (CNRA) at the University of California in Irvine.

name: Northeastern University Network Science Institute
description: Features a PhD in Network Science program.

name: Northeastern University Center for Complex Network Research
description: Led by Albert-László Barabási.

name: Northeastern University MOBS Lab
description: Laboratory for the Modeling of Biological and Socio-technical Systems - Led by Alessandro Vespignani.

name: Pacific Ecoinformatics and Computational Ecology Lab
description: Non-profit study group of ecological networks ("food webs").

name: Peter J. Mucha’s Research Group at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill.
Warren Center for Network & Data Sciences at the University of Pennsylvania.
Cambridge Networks Network (CNN)
description: Research network on complex networks.

name: Centre for Business Network Analysis, University of Greenwich
description: Focused on economic/organisational network analysis.

name: Center for Network Science, Central European University, Budapest
description: Features a PhD in Network Science program.

name: Complex Networks
description: Research group based in Paris.

name: Cx-Nets
description: Virtual collaboration between four complex networks research groups.

name: Data Science Group
description: Wroclaw-based research group that studies, among many things, complex networks and other network-related topics.

name: Digital Humanities
description: Interdisciplinary group of researchers at the Marc Bloch Centre in Berlin, with many network science projects.

name: Forschungscluster der Universitäten Trier und Mainz “Gesellschaftliche Abhängigkeiten und soziale Netzwerke”, in German.
GDR Analyse de réseaux en sciences humaines et sociales – French research group with funds to support training and workshops on network analysis for social scientists.
Historical Network Research (HNR)
description: Platform for scholars interested in network analysis for historical research.

name: HNR Conferences, Workshops and Other Events.
HNR Talks
description: Videos, in German.

name: ANR-Lab
description: International Laboratory for Applied Network Research - Russian group based at the National Research University in Moscow.

name: Theory and Methods in Network Analysis (“TMSA”) Summer Schools.
Large Graphs and Networks
description: Research group at the Catholic University of Louvain (official page).

name: MelNet Social Network Research Group, Swinburne University of Technology.
Mitchell Centre for Social Network Analysis, University of Manchester
description: Currently studies covert networks.

name: Murata Laboratory
description: Tokyo-based research group, studying bi-, tri- and k-partite (hyper)networks.

name: NetLab
description: Research network at the University of Toronto, led by Barry Wellman.

name: Network Science Research Centre, Swansea University.
Network Dynamics
description: Research Lab at McGill University, led by Derek Ruths

name: Netzwerkerei
description: Historical research project on the connections between Jewish intellectuals.

name: ORIO
description: Observatoire des Réseaux Intra- et Inter-Organisationnels - A research program on networks and regulation.

name: ‘Réseaux et Régulation’ Conference Cycle
description: Seminar based at Sciences Po in Paris, France.

name: Redes-Sociales, in Spanish
description: Information network based at the Universitat Autònoma de Barcelona.

name: RES-HIST : Réseaux et histoire, in French
description: Blog posts from a research group on historical networks.

name: SocioPatterns
description: Interdisciplinary research group that uses wireless sensors to study social network data.

name: SoNAR-C
description: Social Network Analysis Research Center, University of Italian Switzerland (USi).

name: Topographies of Entanglements. Mapping Medieval Networks
description: Research platform based at the Austrian Academy of Sciences that focuses on applying network theory and visualisation to medieval history.

name: UCL Centre for Organisational Network Analysis (CONA).
Virtual Observatory for the Study of Online Networks (VOSON)
description: Research and software development project located at the Australian National University.

name: Analyse de réseaux et histoire, in French (Revue d'histoire moderne et contemporaine, 2005).
Analyser les réseaux du passé en archéologie et en histoire, in French (Les Nouvelles de l'Archéologie, 2014).

Formale Methoden der Netzwerkanalyse in den Geschichtswissenschaften: Warum und Wie? [Formal Network Methods in History: Why and How?], in German (preprint in English; Österreichische Zeitschrift für Geschichtswissenschaften, 2012).
From Hermeneutics to Data to Networks: Data Extraction and Network Visualization of Historical Sources (Programming Historian, 2015).
Graph Theory and Networks in Biology (preprint; IET Systems Biology, 2007).
Introduction à la visualisation de données : l’analyse de réseau en histoire, in French (Geschichte und Informatik, 2015).
Introduction : où en est l'analyse de réseaux en histoire ? [Introducción: ¿en qué punto se encuentra el análisis de redes en Historia?], in French (also in Spanish; REDES, 2011).
Networks of Power in Archaeology (Annual Review of Anthropology, 2014).
Netzwerkanalyse in den Geschichtswissenschaften. Historische Netzwerkanalyse als Methode für die Erforschung von historischen Prozessen, in German (Prozesse. Formen, Dynamiken, Erklärungen, 2015).
The Roots and Shoots of Archaeological Network Analysis: A Citation Analysis and Review of the Archaeological Use of Formal Network Methods (Archaeological Review from Cambridge, 2014).
Thinking Through Networks: A Review of Formal Network Methods in Archaeology (Journal of Archaeological Method and Theory, 2013).
Assessing Impact and Quality from Local Dynamics of Citation Networks (Journal of Informetrics, 2012).
Extracting Citation Networks from Publications in Classics (Digital Humanities Quarterly, forthcoming).
Self-Citations, Co-Authorships and Keywords: A New Approach to Scientists' Field Mobility? (Scientometrics, 2007).
Socio-Semantic Frameworks (preprint; Advances in Complex Systems, 2013).
Tradition and Innovation in Scientists' Research Strategies (Annual Review of Sociology, 2015).
Biological Networks (Handbook of Graph Drawing and Visualization, 2013).
Network Analysis: An Integrative Approach to the Structure of Psychopathology (Annual Review of Clinical Psychology, 2013).
Network Biology: Understanding the Cell’s Functional Organization
description: Accessible introduction to (cellular) network analysis (Nature Reviews Genetics, 2004).

name: Network Medicine: A Network-based Approach to Human Disease (Nature Review Genetics, 2011).
Social Networks and the Spread of Infectious Diseases: the AIDS Example (Social Networks, 1985).
Structure and Dynamics of Molecular Networks: A Novel Paradigm of Drug Discovery. A Comprehensive Review
description: Also includes an impressive list of network analysis software (Pharmacology & Therapeutics, 2013).

name: The Architecture of Complexity
description: From network theory to complexity theory (IEEE Control Systems Magazine, 2007).

name: Complex Systems and Networks (special issue of Science, 2009).
Statistical Mechanics of Complex Networks (Reviews of Modern Physics, 2002).
The Structure and Function of Complex Networks (SIAM Review, 2003).
A Cautionary Note on Data Inputs and Visual Outputs in Social Network Analysis (SNA) (preprint; British Journal of Management, 2014).
Ethical Dilemmas in Social Network Research (special issue of Social Networks, 2005).
Ethical and Strategic Issues in Organizational Social Network Analysis (The Journal of Applied Behavioral Science, 2003).
A Brief History of Statistical Models for Network Analysis and Open Challenges (Journal of Computational and Graphical Statistics, 2012).
Introduction to Stochastic Actor-Based Models for Network Dynamics (preprint; Social Networks, 2010).
Positional Analysis and Blockmodeling (preprint; Computational Complexity, 2012).
Social Network Evolution and Actor Oriented Models (Mathematics & Social Sciences, 1997).
Statistical Models for Social Networks (Annual Review of Sociology, 2011).
A Survey of Statistical Network Models
description: Book-length review (preprint; Foundations and Trends in Machine Learning, 2010).

name: A Unified View of Generative Models for Networks: Models, Methods, Opportunities, and Challenges (video presentation; NIPS 2014 workshop on “Networks: From Graphs to Rich Data”).
Explorations into the Visualization of Policy Networks (Journal of Theoretical Politics, 1999).
Graphical Techniques for Exploring Social Network Data (Models and Methods in Social Network Analysis, 2005).
Methods of Social Network Visualization (Encyclopedia of Complexity and Systems Science, 2009; poster version).
Social Networks (Handbook of Graph Drawing and Visualization, 2013).
A propos de la notion de rôle dans l'analyse des relations sociales (Mathématiques et sciences humaines, 2011).
Dynamic Scientific Co-Authorship Networks (Models of Science Dynamics, 2012).
Birds of a Feather: Homophily in Social Networks (Annual Review of Sociology, 2001).
Mixed-Method Approaches to Social Network Analysis (ESRC NCRM Discussion Paper, 2010).
Network Analysis and Political Science (Annual Review of Political Science, 2011).
Network Analysis for International Relations (International Organization, 2009).
Network Analysis in the Social Sciences (Science, 2009).
Networks in Social Psychology, Beginning with Kurt Lewin (preprint; Encyclopedia of Social Network Analysis and Mining, 2014).
Networks in the Understanding of Economic Behaviors (Journal of Economic Perspectives, 2014).
Positions and Roles (The SAGE Handbook of Social Network Analysis, 2011).
The Social and the Sexual: Networks in Contemporary Demographic Research (PSC Working Paper Series, 2013).
Social Network Analysis in the Study of Terrorism and Political Violence (preprint; PS: Political Science and Politics, 2011).
Aux sources des grands réseaux d’interactions. Retour sur quelques propriétés déterminantes des réseaux sociaux issus de corpus documentaires, by Pascal Cristofoli, in French
description: Reviews the current state of relational sociology and network analysis in light of the large-scale and online data (Réseaux, 2008).

name: Birds of a Feather, Or Friend of a Friend? Using Exponential Random Graph Models to Investigate Adolescent Social Networks, by Steven M. Goodreau, James A. Kitts and Martina Morris
description: Accessible introduction to the logic and application of exponential random graph modeling (Demography, 2001).

name: Chains of Affection: The Structure of Adolescent Romantic and Sexual Networks, by Peter S. Bearman, James Moody and Katherine Stovel
description: Classic example of topological network analysis applied to a network of affective and sexual ties (American Journal of Sociology, 2004).

name: Coauthorship and Citation Patterns in the Physical Review, by Travis Martin et al.
description: Highly typical study of scientific publishing productivity and collaboration through temporal network analysis (preprint; Physical Review E, 2013).

name: The Convergence of Social and Technological Networks, by Jon Kleinberg
description: Discusses small-world effects and social contagion within the context of the Internet and social media (Communications of the ACM, 2008).

name: Deux traditions d'analyse des reseaux sociaux, by Michael Eve (English version; Réseaux, 2002).
Homophily and Contagion Are Generically Confounded in Observational Social Network Studies, by Cosma R. Shalizi and Andrew C. Thomas
description: Makes a very important point for the analysis of network diffusion and influence (Sociological Methods and Research, 2011).

name: La notion de réseau complexe : du réseau comme abstraction et outil à la masse de données des réseaux sociaux en ligne, by Alain Barrat, in French
description: Accessible introduction to the study of complex networks (Communication & Organisation, 2013).

name: Network Analysis, Culture, and the Problem of Agency, by Mustafa Emirbayer and Jeff Goodwin (American Journal of Sociology, 1994), and Manifesto for a Relational Sociology, by Mustafa Emirbayer (American Journal of Sociology, 1997)
description: Sociological foundations for a science of social ties.

name: Network Theory, Plot Analysis, by Franco Moretti
description: Example applications of (fictional) network analysis in literary studies (New Left Review, 2011).

name: Node Centrality in Weighted Networks: Generalizing Degree and Shortest Paths, by Tore Opsahl, Filip Agneessens and John Skvoretz
description: Explores the generalization of network centrality and distance measures to (positively) valued graphs (Social Networks, 2010; companion website).

name: Scale-Free Networks, by Albert-László Barabási and Eric Bonabeau
description: Early, accessible formulation of the “networks are everywhere” argument (Scientific American, 2003).

name: Social Networks and Causal Inference, by Tyler J. VanderWeele and Weihua An
description: Reviews the different ways in which network analysis can produce meaningful causal statements, as well as the inherent limits of network analysis for doing so (Handbook of Causal Analysis for Social Research, 2013).

name: The Performativity of Networks, by Kieran Healy
description: Network analysis meets science studies: social networks, like financial markets, are highly subject to performativity, i.e. the possibility that reality might be altered by its theoretical inquiry (European Journal of Sociology, 2015).

name: Revisiting the Foundations of Network Analysis, by Carter T. Butts
description: On choosing the right network representation to frame a research problem.

name: Robust Action and the Rise of the Medici, 1400-1434, by John F. Padgett and Christopher K. Ansell
description: Classic analysis of power relations in the Renaissance Florentine state (American Journal of Sociology, 1993).

name: The Strength of Weak Ties, by Mark Granovetter
description: Arch-classic example of applying network analysis to a social issue: jobseeking (American Journal of Sociology, 1973).

name: The Ties that Divide: A Network Analysis of the International Monetary System, 1890–1910 (The Journal of Economic History, 2005) and The Empirics of International Currencies: Network Externalities, History and Persistence (The Economic Journal, 2009), both by Marc Flandreau and Clemens Jobst
description: Network analysis of the foreign exchange system in the late 19th century (data).

name: Topics in Social Network Analysis and Network Science, by A. James O'Malley and Jukka-Pekka Onnela
description: 50-page introduction to network analysis, with just the right amount of detail on all aspects of it (The Handbook of Health Services Research, forthcoming 2017).

name: ArcGIS Network Analyst
description: Network-based spatial analysis software for solving complex routing problems.

name: CFinder
description: Cross-platform Java program to identify clusters and communities through the Clique Percolation Method (CPM).

name: Circos
description: Cross-platform program to produce circular layouts of network data, written in Perl.

name: Cytoscape
description: Cross-platform Java program to build, analyze and visualize networks. Also a JavaScript library.

name: Network Analysis with Cytoscape Tutorial
description: Illustrated through an archaeological and geographical case study (2013).

name: Discourse Network Analyzer (DNA)
description: Qualitative content analysis tool with network export facilities, written in Java with R integration.

name: E-Net
description: Windows program for ego network analysis.

name: EgoNet
description: Cross-platform Java program for ego network analysis.

name: EgoWeb
description: Server-side software for social network data collection and processing.

name: easyN
description: Online tool aimed at representing and sharing gene interaction networks as well as Petri net models.

name: Gephi
description: Cross-platform, free and open source tool for network visualization.

name: Clément Levallois’ Gephi Tutorials and Plugins.
Geographische Netzwerkvisualisierung mit dem Programm ‘Gephi’, in German (2016).
Introduction to Network Analysis and Visualization with Gephi (2015).
Practical Social Network Analysis With Gephi (2014).
GLEAMviz Simulator
description: Cross-platform tool intended for the prediction of human epidemics.

name: Graphviz
description: Cross-platform software to draw graphs in the DOT graph drawing language.

name: Graphy
description: Graph theory library written in Ruby.

name: GraphX
description: Apache Spark module to perform graph-related parallel computation.

name: Lynks
description: Web-based tool for simple network analysis and visualization.

name: Mathematica
description: Cross-platform program with graph theory and network analysis functionalities.

name: IGraph/M
description: Interface to use the igraph library from within Mathematica, using standard Mathematica Graph objects.

name: MuxViz
description: Cross-platform, free and open source tool to study multilayer networks, based on R and GNU Octave.

name: Neo4j
description: Open source, scalable graph database, used by companies like Linkurious.

name: Network Canvas
description: Set of tools to collect personal network data (in early development).

name: Nodegoat
description: Web-based data management, network analysis and visualisation environment (blog).

name: NodeXL
description: Free, open-source template to explore network graphs with Microsoft Excel.

name: The NodeXL Series
description: Series of blog posts on using NodeXL (2013).

name: ORA-LITE
description: Windows program for dynamic meta-network assessment and analysis.

name: OSoMe
description: Web-based platform to analyze social media data, including through Twitter-based and co-occurrence networks.

name: Pajek
description: Windows program for large network analysis, free for noncommercial use.

name: Analyse des réseaux : une introduction à Pajek, in French (2011).
La détection de communautés avec Pajek 3.6, in French (2012).
Palladio
description: Web-based spatial network visualization tool by the Humanities + Design research lab at Stanford University.

name: PARTNER
description: Program to Analyze, Record, and Track Networks to Enhance Relationships - Excel-based tool for building networks from surveys.

name: PIGALE
description: Public Implementation of a Graph Algorithm Library and Editor - Windows program and C++ library to analyze planar graphs.

name: PNet
description: Simulation and estimation of (one-mode and multilevel) exponential random graph models (ERGMs), written in Java for Windows.

name: Polinode
description: Web-based platform to both analyze network data as well as collect network data via relationship-based surveys.

name: PUCK
description: Program for the Use and Computation of Kinship data - Cross-platform Java program for genealogical network analysis.

name: Radatools
description: Set of tools intended for the analysis of complex networks, built on top of Radalib, a library written in Ada.

name: SageMath
description: Free open-source mathematics software with extensive graph capabilities.

name: Segrada
description: Cross-platform tool to build and visualize semantic graph databases.

name: Siena
description: Simulation Investigation for Empirical Network Analysis. Formerly a Windows program, now developed as the RSiena R package.

name: SocNetV
description: Social Network Visualizer - Cross-platform program that includes a simple Web crawler to construct hyperlink networks.

name: SoNIA
description: Social Network Image Animator - Tool to visualize dynamic or longitudinal network data. Formerly a Java program (example movies), now developed as the ndtv R package.

name: SparklingGraph
description: Cross-platform tool to perform large-scale, distributed network computations with Apache Spark's GraphX module; written in Java and Scala.

name: SPaTo Visual Explorer
description: Cross-platform program for the visualization and exploration of complex networks.

name: StOCNET
description: Several Windows programs developed by the same team as Siena.

name: Tulip
description: Cross-platform network analysis and visualization framework built on top of a C++ library, with plugins dedicated to specific biological and physical networks. Also available through its Python package.

name: UCINET
description: Windows commercial software package for the analysis of social network data.

name: Uberlink
description: Software suite for online (hyperlink) network analysis, by the VOSON research project.

name: VOSON System
description: Web-based software for the collection and analysis of online network data.

name: VOSON Data Provider for NodeXL (quick tutorial; to be discontinued in 2016).
vosonR
description: R client for the VOSON software (in development).

name: UNISoN
description: Cross-platform program to download and visualize Usenet data. Developed for a Masters degree.

name: VennMaker: An Actor-Centered Interactive Network Mapping Tool
description: Cross-platform Java program for ego network analysis.

name: VennMaker for Historians: Sources, Social Networks and Software (also available in Spanish; 2011).
Visone
description: Cross-platform Java network analysis and visualization program, free for noncommercial use.

name: Network Analysis with Visone Tutorial
description: Illustrated through an archaeological case study (2015).

name: Vizster
description: Cross-platform Java program to visualize online social networks.

name: VOSviewer
description: Cross-platform Java tool for constructing and visualizing bibliometric networks.

name: algo.graph
description: Basic graph theory algorithms written in Clojure.

name: CONGA and CONGO
description: Algorithms to detect overlapping communities in networks, written in Java.

name: ForceAtlas2
description: Force-directed layout included in Gephi (paper).

name: Linkcomm
description: Link Communities in Complex Networks - Community detection algorithms, available in C++, Python and R.

name: MixNet
description: Erdös-Rényi Mixture Model for Networks - Community detection method, available in C++ and R.

name: OSLOM2
description: Order Statistics Local Optimization Method - Clustering algorithm.

name: vbmod: Variational Bayesian Inference for Network Modularity
description: MATLAB and Python implementations of a Bayesian community detection algorithm.

name: weighted-modularity-LPAwbPLUS
description: Julia, MATLAB and R implementations of two algorithms to find weighted modularity in bipartite networks.

name: Benchmark Graphs to Test Community Detection Algorithms
description: C++ code to generate weighted and unweighted graphs.

name: BGL
description: Boost Graph Library - C++ library that provides a generic interface to access graph structures.

name: igraph
description: C library of network analysis tools; also exists as packages for Python and R.

name: MapEquation
description: C++ code for the Infomap method of multilevel community detection.

name: Louvain Method
description: C++ code for the Louvain multi-level community detection algorithm.

name: networks.tb
description: C program designed for analyzing socio-semantic networks. Runs on Linux and Mac OS X.

name: OGDF
description: Open Graph Drawing Framework - Self-contained C++ class library for diagram, network and tree layouts.

name: OpenOrd: Large-scale Graph Layout (formerly DrL)
description: C++ algorithm, also available as a Gephi plugin.

name: Stanford Network Analysis Project
description: C++ general purpose network analysis and graph mining library. Available as a Python library and in Microsoft Excel via NodeXL.

name: Walktrap
description: C++ program that implements the WalkTrap community detection algorithm.

name: Cytoscape.js
description: Network analysis and visualization library.

name: d3.js
description: JavaScript visualization library that can plot force-directed graphs.

name: d3-force: Force-directed graph layout using velocity Verlet integration.
d3-vector: Define connections between nodes as directional vectors, consisting of angles and magnitudes.
GENSI
description: JavaScript graphical tool to collect ego-centered network data (paper).

name: GoJS
description: Visualization library to draw diagrams and several types of network layouts.

name: Graphology
description: Specification and reference implementation for a robust and multipurpose JavaScript Graph object.

name: greuler
description: Visualization library to build and manipulate graphs through a simple API. Powered by d3.js and WebCola.

name: jLouvain
description: Louvain community detection for Javascript (example).

name: Popoto.js
description: Library based on d3.js that provides a graph based search interface.

name: Sigma
description: JavaScript library dedicated to graph drawing.

name: vis.js
description: JavaScript library with network visualization capabilities.

name: VivaGraphJS
description: Graph drawing library (ForceAtlas2 plugin).

name: viz.js
description: Use Graphviz in Web pages.

name: BayesNets.jl
description: Package to work with Bayesian networks.

name: Smile.jl
description: Julia wrapper for the Smile C++ library, which covers Bayesian networks and influence diagrams.

name: EcologicalNetwork.jl
description: Package to compute measures of ecological network structures.

name: EvolvingGraphs
description: Package to create, manipulate and study time-dependent networks.

name: Graphs.jl
description: Package to manipulate graph objects in Julia.

name: Creating Network Diagrams in Plotly from Julia.
JuliaGraphs
description: Suite of Julia packages for network analysis.

name: GraphVisualize.jl
description: Graph visualization built on top of GLVisualize.jl.

name: LightGraphs.jl
description: Graph library with a focus on performance and simplicity.

name: LightGraphsExtras.jl
description: Community detection and other functionalities for the LightGraphs.jl package.

name: NetworkLayout.jl
description: Layout algorithms for graphs and trees.

name: Networks.jl
description: Additional graph functions for the LightGraphs.jl package.

name: GraphCentrality.jl
description: Adds network measures to the Graphs.jl package.

name: MatrixNetworks.jl
description: A method to handle graph/matrix/network structures.

name: NetworkFlows.jl
description: Package of network flows algorithms.

name: NetworkViz.jl
description: Package to visualize graphs produced with LightGraphs.jl, using ThreeJS.jl.

name: Video presentation of the package by its author at JuliaCon 2016.
PhyloNetworks.jl
description: Package to manipulate, analyze and visualize phylogenetic networks.

name: TikzGraphs
description: Package to create graph layouts using the TikZ graphics language.

name: Brain Connectivity Toolbox
description: Toolbox for complex-network analysis of structural and functional brain-connectivity data, with links to many related projects.

name: CONTEST
description: Random network toolbox that implements nine network models.

name: Generalized Louvain
description: Variant of the Louvain community detection algorithm.

name: MatlabBGL
description: Graph library based on the C++ Boost Graph Library.

name: MATLAB RBN Toolbox
description: Simulation und visualization of Random Boolean Networks.

name: graph-tool
description: Python module for network manipulation and analysis, written mostly in C++ for speed.

name: graphviz
description: Python renderer for the DOT graph drawing language.

name: linkpred
description: Assess the likelihood of potential links in a future snapshot of a network.

name: metaknowledge
description: Python package to turn bibliometrics data into authorship and citation networks.

name: networkx
description: Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.

name: Implementing an ERGM from Scratch in Python, using networkx and numpy (2014).
nxviz
description: Visualization package for NetworkX.

name: npartite
description: Python algorithms for community detection in n-partite networks.

name: PyGraphistry
description: Python library to extract, transform, and visually explore big graphs.

name: python-igraph
description: Python version of the igraph network analysis package.

name: python-louvain
description: A solid implementation of Louvain community detection algorithm.

name: TQ (Temporal Quantities)
description: Python 3 library for temporal network analysis.

name: amen
description: Additive and multiplicative effects models for relational data.

name: Bergm
description: Tools to analyse Bayesian exponential random graph models (BERGM).

name: bipartite
description: Functions to visualize bipartite networks and compute indices commonly used in ecological research.

name: blockmodeling
description: Implementats generalized blockmodeling for valued networks.

name: bnlearn
description: Tools for Bayesian network learning and inference (related Shiny app).

name: btergm
description: Tools to fit temporal ERGMs by bootstrapped pseudolikelihood. Also provides MCMC maximum likelihood estimation, goodness of fit for ERGMs, TERGMs, and stochastic actor-oriented models (SAOMs), and tools for the micro-level interpretation of ERGMs and TERGMs.

name: CCAS
description: Statistical model for communication networks.

name: concoR
description: Implementation of the CONCOR network blockmodeling algorithm (blog post).

name: ContentStructure
description: Implements an extension to the Topic-Partitioned Multinetwork Embeddings (TPME) model.

name: DiagrammeR
description: Connects R, RStudio and JavaScript libraries to draw graph diagrams (blog post).

name: ergm
description: Estimation of Exponential Random Graph Models (ERGM).

name: GERGM
description: Estimation and diagnosis of the convergence of Generalized Exponential Random Graph Models (GERGM).

name: geomnet
description: Single-geometry approach to network visualization with ggplot2.

name: ggnetwork
description: Multiple-geometries approach to plot network objects with ggplot2.

name: ggraph
description: Grammar of graph graphics built in the spirit of ggplot2.

name: hergm
description: Estimate and simulate hierarchical exponential-family random graph models (HERGM) with local dependence.

name: igraph
description: A collection of network analysis tools.

name: Network Analysis and Visualization with R and igraph (2016).
influenceR
description: Compute various node centrality network measures by Burt, Borgatti and others.

name: keyplayer
description: Implements several network centrality measures.

name: latentnet
description: Latent position and cluster models for network objects.

name: lpNet
description: Linear programming model aimed at infering biological (signalling, gene) networks.

name: networkD3
description: D3 JavaScript network graphs from R.

name: ndtv
description: Tools to construct animated visualizations of dynamic network data in various formats.

name: netdiffuseR
description: Tools to analyze the network diffusion of innovations.

name: NetSim
description: Simulate and combine micro-models to research their impact on the macro-features of social networks.

name: network
description: Basic tools to manipulate relational data in R.

name: networkdiffusion
description: Simulate and visualize basic epidemic diffusion in networks.

name: networkDynamic
description: Support for dynamic, (inter)temporal networks.

name: networksis
description: Tools to simulate bipartite networks/graphs with the degrees of the nodes fixed and specified.

name: PAFit
description: Nonparametric estimation of preferential attachment and node fitness in temporal complex networks.

name: PCIT
description: Implements Partial Correlation with Information Theory in order to identify meaningful correlations in weighted networks, such as gene co-expression networks.

name: RCy3
description: Interface between R and recent versions of Cytoscape.

name: RCyjs
description: Interface between R and Cytoscape.js.

name: qgraph
description: Tools to model and visualize psychometric networks; also aimed at weighted graphical models).

name: qgraph: Network Visualizations of Relationships in Psychometric Data (2012).
relevent
description: Tools to fit relational event models (REM).

name: rem
description: Estimate endogenous network effects in event sequences and fit relational event models (REM), which measure how networks form and evolve over time.

name: rgexf
description: Export network objects from R to GEXF for manipulation with software like Gephi or Sigma.

name: Rgraphviz
description: Support for using the Graphviz library and its DOT graph drawing language from within R.

name: RSiena
description: Simulation Investigation for Empirical Network Analysis; fits models to longitudinal network data.

name: sna
description: Basic network constructors, measures and visualization tools.

name: SocialMediaLab
description: Tools for collecting social media data and generating networks from it (companion website, github repo).

name: spectralGOF
description: Computes the spectral goodness of fit (SGOF), a measure of how well a network model explains the structure of an observed network.

name: spnet
description: Methods for dealing with spatial social networks.

name: statnet
description: The project behind many R network analysis packages (mailing-list, wiki).

name: Exponential Random Graph Models (ERGMs) Using statnet (2015).
Guides for Using the statnet Package (2010).
tergm
description: Fit, simulate and diagnose models for temporal exponential-family random graph models (TERGM).

name: tnam
description: Tools to fit temporal and cross-sectional network autocorrelation models (TNAM).

name: tnet
description: Network measures for weighted, two-mode and longitudinal networks.

name: tsna
description: Tools for temporal social network analysis.

name: visNetwork
description: Using vis.js library for network visualization.

name: xergm
description: Extensions of exponential random graph models (ERGM, GERGM, TERGM, TNAM and REM).

name: nwcommands: Network Analysis Using Stata (discussion, tutorials and slides).
SNA with Stata
description: Blog documenting the use of the netplot Stata package.

name: DOT
description: Graph drawing syntax used by the Graphviz software.

name: GEXF
description: File format used by the Gephi software.

name: GraphML
description: Comprehensive and easy-to-use file format for graphs (handbook chapter).

name: JGraphT
description: Java graph library for graph data structures and algorithms (example algorithms).

name: JUNG
description: Java Universal Network/Graph Framework - Extensible library to represent network objects.

name: PGF/TikZ
description: Tandem of vector graphics languages that can be used to draw graphs in the LaTeX typesetting environment.

name: How to Draw Graphs in LaTeX?

name: TLP
description: Tulip Software Graph Format - Graph syntax used by the Tulip software framework.

name: Cypher
description: Graph query language used by Neo4j.
